title: Processes - Area Between Curves Function of y

content.question:
Let <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> be the region bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, the natural log of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></math>, the vertical line <math alttext="x equals e squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, and the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis, as shown in the figure. Which of the following integrals are equal to the area of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> ?
<math alttext="the integral from 1 to e squared, of, the natural log of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="the integral from 0 to 2, of, e to the y power, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="the integral from 0 to 2, of, open parenthesis, e squared, minus e to the y power, close parenthesis, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.5: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of y

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
